ocw.mit.edu as an overall uh statement
about the course it is uh the aim is to
bring the Learned discipline called
engineering ethics
to the students uh and my goal is to get
them to um talk in ethical categories
and to be able to understand engineering
at a philosophical level uh and my uh
approach to doing that is to treat the
course or engineering ethics as a uh an
engagement of two other learning
disciplines in this class what seemed to
work was the approach of being many
discipline of many disciplines I brought
uh the great pieces of art into this
class and I talked about how
Raphael's um um uh mass at bosina gave a
picture of what engineering really is as
distinct from uh mathematics for example
when you look at Raphael's uh the school
at Athens so I brought the high arts in
uh we talked about literature
uh one part of talking one way to talk
about literature is to talk about
literature is presented in in in the
cinema students go to movies they like
the movies and what worked in the class
was that the students today young people
today are very good at critiquing a film
so I was able to bring out ethical
points by way of of of of
film uh the third part was that I had no
hesitation in the class or as I do it in
my writing to talk about experiences
that I've had in my personal life with
my family
ethics as it seems at first to be very
amorphous kind of uh subject but it can
be approached
systematically that not everything that
everybody says is right uh if they come
up to a conclusion not every way they
try to justify it uh is something that
is defensible uh so being engineering
students they were very happy to see
that uh ethics is just as
rigorous as science mathematics and
Engineering the engineering faculty
here
um are skeptical about a course on
engineering
ethics uh because many of them don't see
how they can use it in their
classes uh but there's a large
literature on how to use engineering
ethics in engineering
problems uh and um I think that their
attitudes about how to fit this course
into an already busy schedule uh will
change once they see how to make an
ordinary engineering problem an ethical
problem
